item.title: The Basics of Design Elements
item.description:
The Basics of Design Elements

From the fantastic blog over at Zapier, The Basics of Design Elements. Zapier consistently publishes quality content for its usersâ€”a clear sign that they understand who their users are and what topics interest them. I wish more of the SaaS companies that I subscribe to would publish content with the same level of quality that Zapier does.

item.title: Five facts: How customer analytics boosts corporate performance
item.description:
Five facts: How customer analytics boosts corporate performance

Corporations across the world and industry sectors are increasingly approaching their businesses from a customer-centric perspective, amassing vast quantities of customer intelligence in the process. But harnessing this data deluge is a huge challenge. Companies need to understand that it is not the IT that counts so much as what you do with it.

item.title: How to Set Up a Google Analytics Experiments Split Test
item.description:
How to Set Up a Google Analytics Experiments Split Test

Tell you what. In this post, I will show you how you can set up your first simple test completely for free. Do you need any special skills? No. Do you need to sign up for a trial of an expensive A/B testing software? No. The stack we'll use is: Google Analytics Experiments and WordPress.

item.title: Why Smarter Data is Better Data
item.description:
Why Smarter Data is Better Data

At a recent event at Wharton San Francisco, WCAI Co-Directors Eric Bradlow Pete Fader, together with Bill Franks, Chief Analytics Officer at Teradata discussed why intelligently compressing datasets should be part of any organization's analytics best practices. Why is smaller smarter?
